alert.note: Alert for Rensselaer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 8:49AM EST until December 18 at 10:30AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following counties, Rensselaer, Saratoga and Washington. * WHEN...Until noon EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 849 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Troy, Mechanicville, Hoosick Falls, Salem, Grafton, Cambridge, Greenwich, Center Brunswick, Wynantskill, Wyantskill, Averill Park, West Sand Lake, Gates, Halfmoon, North Greenbush, Brunswick, Sand Lake, Lee, Pittstown and Northumberland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
